title: 'Saturday Night Live' Alum David Spade Gets $19.5 Million for Beverly Hills Home; The Trousdale Estates home was listed a month ago for just under $20 million, got multiple offers
text:
The "Saturday Night Live" alum bought the Beverly Hills property for around $4 million in 2001. This past fall he purchased another home in the Hollywood Hills for $13.85 million, records show.

Designed by architect Edward Fickett, the Beverly Hills house was built in 1978. Over the years, Mr. Spade renovated the roughly 6,400-square-foot home, which has four bedrooms and three fireplaces. He added a sleek metal parapet to the roofline, updated his-and-hers primary bathrooms and expanded the TV room, which has a bar. There is also a sunken great room with roughly 20-foot ceilings, floor-to-ceiling windows and sliding glass doors that open to a patio.

The roughly Â¾-acre property also has a motor court, three-car garage, pool and tennis court. Rayni and Branden Williams of the Beverly Hills Estates represented the buyer.

Mr. Spade is the host of a new podcast, "Fly on the Wall," with fellow SNL alum Dana Carvey.

In Beverly Hills, the median price for a single-family home was $8.2 million during 2021's fourth quarter, up 15.7% from the prior year, according to real estate appraisal firm Miller Samuel. The number of sales shot up 89.3% during the quarter compared with the same period of 2020.

Eric Schmidt, the former chief executive of Google, recently paid $65 million for a roughly 120-acre piece of undeveloped land in Beverly Hills that was owned by late Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen, the Journal reported. In January, "Full House" creator Jeff Franklin listed his Beverly Hills estate for $85 million.

'Saturday Night Live' Alum David Spade Gets $19.5 Million for Beverly Hills Home
